website_summaries.verdict: Good customer ratings, with very accurate and fast O2 saturation readings.
pros: Reads pulse rate and O2 information quickly
Lightweight and easy to take with you
Shuts off automatically after use so battery is not wasted
cons: User must remain very still during testing or readings can be inconsistent

customer_reviews.title: As accurate as my hospital grade oximeter
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse who works in a hospital, and I can confirm that this small cute oximeter is as accurate as the couple thousand oximeter I use every day at work. Beautiful bright led screen and nice strap, batteries are included which is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Vlshrz

customer_reviews.title: Pocket sized, accurate. and fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely useful device to have at home to help monitor blood oxygen levels. The batteries are included, it is easy to use and has a clinical design. It comes with a lanyard and provides quick and accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent oximeter
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and I like its size is excellent for use with children and adults
customer_reviews.author: Alondra C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Handy and accurate, easy to use. I hope it has a pouch or protector :) fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: Dark Avenger

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got it to use for altitude training, but found it useful in the COVID era checking SPO2 of my sick family members. I found it accurate within 2-3% SPO2, and within 5bpm compared to a hospital grade device. Another important point is that it shows rolling average of 8 seconds, updating every second. The display is big, bright, and easy to read except in direct sunlight. Every once out of many uses it will give an obviously improper read (near death values), maybe it's just operator error, because removing and repositioning it fixes the issue. Definitely worth the $20 or so
customer_reviews.author: Yevgenius

customer_reviews.title: Necessary thing
customer_reviews.text: So overall impression is good.Works well.Comes with the batteries in set but I did not use them,I installed the rechargeable ones.Due to pandemy this device can help to determine the oxygen level in blood.Not precisely but enough to understand if everything is ok or not.The thing that I did not like too much is the screen light.I am ok,but my parents can not read the results without glasses, everything blands in
customer_reviews.author: Olenka

customer_reviews.title: Works but not the best
customer_reviews.text: this products works fine. However I'm a respiratory therapist and I don't think that it gives the most accurate reading all the time. With that being said I will be purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Product works great! It’s been simple to use right out of the box! You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: A&CBarnes

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget to have at home
customer_reviews.text: I admittedly didn't need this for existing health concerns, but as we take precautions for Covid, or any sickness really, I thought it would be good to have one at home. It's certainly easy to use, just one button to push and there's a reading within about 5 seconds. I can see my pulse in real time, which proves that feature is accurate. I don't have a way of testing the oxygen saturation reading for accuracy, except that the readings display the same normal range I've seen when visiting the doctor over the past few years. I like it, and it's comforting to have one at home for a test anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Tarkovsky

customer_reviews.title: Valuable Meter in CV19 days
customer_reviews.text: Wife came home from dentist with SPO2 of 86 measured twice. She freaked out. I got this unit to use at home to reassure her she didn't have CV19 hypoxia. Instant readout. Did my own at 96 and hers at 97... so no worries. Never though about having a pulse ox at home, but it was not expensive and since CV19 presents few symptoms and often hypoxia is an early one... it has value.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: Important as your keys
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted one of my own. The world is crazy now and my temps and oxygen level gets taken twice a day. This purchase was so I would be the only one using the oximeter. My first impression was that it was pretty color. It is very accurate in terms of getting my heart rate and oxygen levels. It also comes with a long cord/chain you could put around your neck. Which would be hard to lose. I definitely reccommend this product to anyone who needs one. It is well worth the cost which is very reasonable
customer_reviews.author: Deon G

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my brother and my elderly father. I got a no-brand one for myself at the same time, so I've had a chance to compare them. They both work very well in terms of ease of use and accuracy, with large, easy to read digits and one-button operation. But this one has a couple of additional features that are pretty nice. For one thing, the padding around the finger is noticeably softer. It also doesn't beep constantly, which is slightly annoying in the no-brand version. So if you're looking for something that's both functional and comfortable, this is a perfect choice!
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Hegazy

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece and family. It works perfectly so I’m very happy with the purchase. My cons: this one was more Expensive than other ones I’ve ordered for other family members (that was ok because many other meters weren’t available at the time because of covid19) but I was disappointed that it didn’t come with a case for the price. That’s not a huge deal because it works well but it would have been nice. Also, because of everything going on at the time of purchase I was happy with the speed of delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M

customer_reviews.title: Seems solid
customer_reviews.text: Played with one of these at a friend's house and decided I wanted one of my own. The HR sensor is totally accurate (I took my pulse manually and it was within a beat of this). It's really useful when working out, and the lanyard makes it easy to hang from the treadmill. The O2 sensor also seems quite accurate. I also like that it takes AAA batteries, instead of a button or some other weird one that would be annoying to find.
customer_reviews.author: YR

customer_reviews.title: Must have device during pandemic
customer_reviews.text: Because of COVID-19 we haven't been able to go to see our doctors for regular check up, i thought to spend some money on few medical device so we bought this one. Today four of us, got the measurement to see if it works. As expected everything was normal. Pulse matched with our heart monitoring device. The oxygen level for all of us was normal which gave us confidence on our health esp during this pandemic. I think it is a must have device for anyone who is concern about their health and may not have easy access to health care service.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Bright and modern
customer_reviews.text: I needed a brighter pulse ox for those days when it’s not dark but not light enough to really see. This one is great. When I used it the first time it read 93% for O2 but it popped up to where it belonged pretty quickly. Since then the only complaint I have is that it’s a little slower than my other pulse ox. It gets the job done. Don’t worry about my heart rate in the video. It’s accurate. I have heart issues that are being treated. The video was taken with only a 40w lamp on and the flash on my phone off to show how bright this pulse ox is.
customer_reviews.author: AleshaJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item to have at home or camping.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool to have in any home or camping med kit. With everything going on with respiratory illnesses lately, it’s nice to be able to see that your oxygen saturation is where it should be. Although I do notice a very slight difference (negligible) in heart rate as compared to my smart watch, it’s within reason for the price point of this item. I’m happy to have it, and it’s not only hand but fun for everybody to use. I think everybody should have one. Would recommend or purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: B C

customer_reviews.title: Quick & easy to read!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this product because of Covid-19. I'm 69 and thought it best to know my oxygen # in case I do get Covid. The product arrived before promised, packaged nicely, comes with batteries and easy set up. Very easy to read screen with I'm pretty sure is accurate info. Three members of my family tested it, everyone's oxygen level was just a bit different. I have to assume accurate as my 6 year old grandson's oxygen was 100%. Very pleased with customer service as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fayzzz2

customer_reviews.title: Accurate & quick
customer_reviews.text: My 3yo son has had issues breathing when he gets sick, and I'm definetly that mom who goes to the hospital every time.. this product is giving accurate readings, and is super simple to use. I've even taught my 3yo how to do it himself. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone with elderly family members, nurses, or even moms of kids who's oxygen levels tend to go down when sick.. definetly cheaper than Others in cost, but still super reliable. This one also includes a lanyard (handy for home health workers and nurses) and batteries are included!
customer_reviews.author: sabrina waters

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This device is very easy to use. I inserted the batteries it came with and followed the instructions. Press the on button and in a few seconds it gives you the numbers
customer_reviews.author: Luis Molina Sandoz

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind, in this Pandemic
customer_reviews.text: I have had my eyes on buying a Oximeter since March of this year, since the news of the Pandemic spread. Just to measure the oxygen levels for everyone in the family. This unit is relatively easy to use. Comes with the batteries needed. Accuracy seems to be good as well! The display is also easy to read, as I got the white colored one and was wondering about the LED screen and reading the numbers capability. Hoping this unit last for a while Pretty handy took for Blood Oxygen level and pulse measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Manpreet Kaur

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product
customer_reviews.text: It is working excellent and easy to use !Perfect Product.
customer_reviews.author: Mehdi Tahernia

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly father. After using it 30 days, I have not found it to be accurate at all! I have an older unit, but was worried it was getting too slow and I can check his O2 level with our blood pressure cuff. Over the last few weeks this unit was reading about 2X what our other units were reading ON PULSE, I just do not trust it. Returning it and looking for a more accurate one.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B (NC)

customer_reviews.title: Important info and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I've been having COVID-like symptoms, and my phone's O2 sensor simply is too hard to use. This is a great one and easy to use, just pop it on and let it do its thing. This uses a pass-through sensor, so the light is on one side of your finger while the sensor is on the other. My research says this is the most accurate style. It seems to give the right readings compared to my phone sensor. I'll take it to a doctors office some day and see how it compares there!
customer_reviews.author: PhoenixCodes

customer_reviews.title: Must have at home like Thermometers
customer_reviews.text: This is the one I was looking for. It has good accuracy. I intend to measure the oxygen level when someone falls sick. Someone told me that oxygen level is really important during sickness and its critical to measure during corona virus sickness. I have it in my back-pocket if I need to use it. In regular day use its good to measure oxygen level after exercises. This is must have at home like thermometers, especially with changing dynamics due to corona virus.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, useful, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: We compared this multiple times to the "pro" one that cost three times as much. It gets your stats right away. The bright white numerals are really easy to read in both a dark and a brightly-lit room. The all-white build and display look really nice- realized my husband was using it as often as I asked him to while he was sick compared to the older model we that was a freebie from the doctor's office. A great product that does the job and looks higher-end.
customer_reviews.author: B Wallis

customer_reviews.title: A Really good Pulse Oximeter
customer_reviews.text: This device was packaged well and includes batteries. Instructions are straightforward. The display is easy to read. The operation of the device is easy. Once you press the power button, place on the finger and the reading will appear shortly. The pulse oximeter is comfortable on a finger. I deducted one star for accuracy because the pulse oximeter was not accurate when using on a child aged 10. However for adults, the readings were accurate.
customer_reviews.author: F. Olalde

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: With all this Covid stuff, a doctor recommended me to purchase a Pulse Oximeter to have it at home and use it in case that I suspect that something is going on and don't want to go to the doctor or even want to have a telemedicine while at home safe. I got this after doing some research before buying and I'm happy with the purchase. Last monday my wife was not feeling well, we called the doctor and with help of the Oximeter he was able to rule out things.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sada

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking, works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This is so nice looking with the white color and blue digital color, I popped the batteries in and it immediately started reading which was nice that it both included batteries and it was super easy to setup, it even has a nice lanyard you can put on it if you want to hang it or make it easier to handle, overall I'm really happy with this purchase, especially with all the breathing virus going around, I know i can check and keep my family safe.
customer_reviews.author: jessica steadman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very compact
customer_reviews.text: I use this product every day (at least when I remember) to check my oxygen level as a precaution during these Covid-19 times. It is very easy to use, just clip it on the finger of choice and push the power button. In a few seconds your O2 and pulse will show in large numbers on the face. You then remove it and you are done. You don’t even have to turn it off, it shuts down almost immediately. I would purchase this one again, and recommend it to anyone that has any reason to monitor their O2 level.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: I received my pulse Oxymeter and am fascinated with how well it works, have checked several times a day already. Am comparing my resting pulse and my walking exercising pulse. It appears to be right on. Didn't know what I was missing, everyone should have one of these. Especially now that covid 19 is with us, it is a really good idea to have one on hand in case one of us becomes ill and with this devise we can monitor our Blood oxygen saturation.
customer_reviews.author: Irishspirit

customer_reviews.title: Smaller finger sizes may have unreliable readings.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my husband who has larger sized fingers. Does not reliably work for my smaller size index finger: 0xygen 47 pulse 38 😳but will give a reading for the left hand middle finger: 99 Oxygen 64 pulse, but not accurate for the right hand. Ring fingers size is a 4.5 to 5 for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Cheemers

customer_reviews.title: Gives peace to your love ones at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this oximeter to measure O2 levels of my family members (another way to track COVID-19 symptoms). Anything below 94% must be reported to a doctor right away, even if you don't have any other symptoms. The oximeter is very easy to use, to read and it gives a fast reading. I purchased 3 and a thermometer; everything have been working fantastic and look very very nice (I have white models only)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It’s a “nope” from me
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work. It gives a reading for a split second then goes to 92 ox, 52 pulse for everyone who I tested it on. Yes, I’m doing it properly. Not worth the aggravation to return.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: i find this product fancy, but numbers are slightly hard to read for my mom had difficulty in reading the numbers.. no case included.. only batteries and lanyard
customer_reviews.author: GWong

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use oximeter
customer_reviews.text: Due to current Covid-19 pandemic, I wanted to buy a oximeter But it was all sold out several month ago and I finally could get this one. It comes with two AAA battery (I like this because I don’t need to buy additional battery) and it has a slick design too. You just need to put your finger in the oximeter and you will get a result after couple of seconds. Checking my pulse and oxygen level in my body is my morning routine now!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie J

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: At first this product was great. Now, it doesn’t work at all. It turns on, then turns off. I tried changing the batteries, and still doesn’t work. I only used it a few times. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Carrie68

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I'm a visit nurse and this has been a great tool for me. At first I wasn't sure it was accurate but I have compared against other oximeters and have tested known subjects and it is spot on. I like that it has an on button (turns off automatically) because it won't accidentally turn on in my travel bag and run down the battery. The white color is nice because it's easy to see in my black bag.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Use it for my workouts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this oximeter because I wanted to test my heartbeat and blood oxygen level during my workouts. As you can see after my intense workout the oxygen level was low. And after I was able to catch my breath for a few minutes the oxygen went back up so this thing works. I also use this in the morning to see my resting heart rate. My heart rate has been dropping due to my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Icebergtech

customer_reviews.title: Good for older kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: Tried this out on everyone in my household, it works great on me and the older members in the family. When i placed it on my younger 2 children i had to hold it on the older of the 2 to get it to read and on my youngest it wouldn't even read with it being held. Definitely for people older than 10
customer_reviews.author: Kearra Prewitt-O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Handy device to have!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little device to have. Especially useful in this situation of Covid-19 It is good to have it around especially if you have a family member or a toddler with history to asthama, breathing issues. It is very simple to use and is very compact to easily fit in a small pouch when you need it during travel. And it comes with batteries too so you are all set to use it directly.
customer_reviews.author: Hari

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.text: The package came to my house the day after I had ordered it which really surprised me. Only one problem that I have is when I take a measurement, lets say it reads 86 O2% and 54 pulse and I quickly take my pulse and it is 76, I will try another reading and it produces a 94 O2% and a 76 pulse, it leaves me wondering what gives. Other then the mysterious reading I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Crud on box
customer_reviews.text: This obviously it was an open box because there are some crud inside as you can see on the photograph. Amazon should not be selling open box items the same price especially if they are dirty. It does seem functional at this point
customer_reviews.author: chris westervelt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This comes as expected and also includes the AAA batteries, which is really nice! The first time I tried it, it gave weird values. Sometimes it flashes a wrong value quickly and then recalculates and gives the correct value. I am not sure if this is just because it is new or just happens normally. I will continue to use it and see if the results are more consistent as time goes on. Overall, it does work well and does give the correct reading after processing for several seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Kris N

customer_reviews.title: easy to read and use and saved us a trip to the hospital
customer_reviews.text: due to the virus we wanted to be able to keep track of our oxygen and temperature, this is perfect for the oxygen part, hubby got a cough and kept checking to make sure all was well, with the virus it got me nervous he might have it but with this little thing we kept a close eye on it and kept us from going to the er when we did not need to.... gave us piece of mind and saved a ton of money!
customer_reviews.author: TNT Townley

customer_reviews.title: You can know your blood oxygenation
customer_reviews.text: After hearing that people present with Covid 19 that do not even realize that they have low oxygen we ordered this to be on guard. It easily and accurately gives important health information, everyone should have one. I was surprised to see the recommendation to discard after 2 years, it must lose accuracy. I do not know if other brands have the same limitation.
customer_reviews.author: Aledo TX

customer_reviews.title: Quick
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work as my old ox went out. I’ve now used it for a week at work.. I love it. It’s accurate, fast, and it’s pretty (reason I purchased). It also works a lot better on cold fingers then the other that I’ve had. I’m a nurse so this is used at least 30 times a day, I haven’t had a issue out of it yet. By far my favorite one I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Burton

customer_reviews.title: Very Modern Design, Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I work in healthcare and checked this device for accuracy. They number matched my high cost SP02 monitor at each change in value. Battery life is excellent and I would definitely suggest consider this brand. I purchased the SP02 monitor for a family member that has breathing complaints, and this monitor confirms that they are getting the O2 that they need. A+ :)
customer_reviews.author: SEAMAZON10

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of things you get from China, not good quality. But seller is willing to refund my money. I give his efforts a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: R L Stre

customer_reviews.title: Not for healthcare workers
customer_reviews.text: It is okay good enough for personal use but if you are in healthcare this is not for you. I'm a CNA and after getting tired of the vital machine not working decided to buy my own (like everyone else) after second use was not reading correctly. After that I accidentally dropped on carpet floor (trying to check batteries) and the power button and face plate came off the light is too dim to see under the room lights. I will clean and keep this for personal use but will be investing into a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use but it doesn’t work got it for my boyfriend who has high blood pressure and heart failure well we have an old one that works and well with this one it showed his oxygen was always low always under 70 and he uses oxygen tanks and his heart rate would be at super high like 170 or super low like 60 so I tried it on myself after jogging it said my oxygen was 89 and my heart rate was 36, umm what. Highly do not recommend purchasing this item. I didn’t want to hassle with returning it so I just through it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it’s accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 80 year old grandma. She has a lot of health problems, and needs her oxygen levels monitored. She’s not tech savvy by any means & she was able to easily figure this out and use on her own. I’d say it’s pretty accurate, we tried it on the same fingers on either hand & they were pretty much the same. The numbers are not small on the screen either.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: No Title
customer_reviews.text: I'm only one day into this item but am pleased with its function. Easy to put together and it got to me with typical amazon speed. I have Afib and am always curious about my heart rate and this will help me in determining that. It had some fluctuation in heart rate but I just repeated doing it. I am confident this will do what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Zeldow

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: This product takes a long time to get an accurate reading. It always reads a really low heart rate for the first 20-30 seconds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good to add Oximeter to first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: I’ve realized the importance to have a pulse oximeter in your first aid kit. This device comes with the batteries and a wrist strap. The device turns on easily and the display is clear. It’s good to know a baseline when you’re healthy to compare to later- I showed at 97-98% oxygen saturation and it never shows 99% which is probably most accurate.
customer_reviews.author: EK Inc

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging horrible
customer_reviews.text: Price was insane nearly 100 percent mark up from 6 days prior.
customer_reviews.author: suzi puckett

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate. But looks nice and sleek.
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this. It gives inconsistent results, it's hard to get an accurate reading... Or even a reading at all. I have used several of these I feel like it does not sit on the finger properly if I hold it by squeezing it I feel like it gives more of an accurate reading. But it doesn't even still seem as if it's very accurate.... I'm going to be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Christi A

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and consistently accurate
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I was initially drawn to this by it's appearance. The white with white glowing display just look nice and clean. However, it is also functional and accurate. I use it once or twice a day to check my oxygen level and heart rate since I have a history of heart and lung issues. I have needed one for awhile now, and I am happy to have found one that works well.
customer_reviews.author: L&L Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great to have during the COVID-19 pandemic!!
customer_reviews.text: As a Emergency Room RN, I get a lot of calls from family and friends worried about if they should be concerned about coughing or other symptoms. One of the best ways to determine is looking at the oxygen saturation. This compact pulse oximeter is just what I needed. From opening the box to use took less than 1 min. Just need to insert the included batteries, hit the power button and place on a finger. The display is clean and easily read. Will definitely recommend to all my nurse friends.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but everybody's a price gouger now
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these they cost double than what they do now. Classic COVID price gouging, am i right? Works great though. Make sure when your finger is ALL THE WAY IN, like touching the edge of the inside. Otherwise you'll get inaccurate readings. Also, don't be running around or walking when you use it. Sit still. 5 stars for the product, -1 star for lack of ethics.
customer_reviews.author: Arsalan Baig

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Per my doctor I needed to buy one since I have high blood pressure during this pregnancy. It’s helped me check it daily and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Accurate,  easy to read and delivered too quickly
customer_reviews.text: It is the coolest pulse oximeter I have ever used. It has good quality and easy to read with reasonable price. It comes with lanyard, manual and 2 AAA batteries easy to install just placed these 2 AAA batteries at the backward position I highly recommend this oximeter for all in this pandemic
customer_reviews.author: AMIBIL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pulse Oximeter
customer_reviews.text: I received the product very quick and in a timely manner. I had my first reading of the pulse and spo2. Perfect it is. Very accurate. I checked the pulse with my apple watch at the same time. Both are matching exact. Superb pulse and oximeter. Very handy and easy to carry while travelling or working out. Nice neck strap to wear it while running. Very happy with the purchase. Thank you for this awesome deal and product.
customer_reviews.author: somesh

customer_reviews.title: Appealing and accurate pulse oximeter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my aunt to track her vitals during these covid times & she seems to be liking it. Looks are appealing; the display is big enough to read and most importantly it correctly provides both Spo2 and pulse data. We compared it to one of the old ones she had and the numbers are fairly accurate.
customer_reviews.author: hr04

customer_reviews.title: Tripled in price in 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a shame this product as tripled in price since November 2019 because of the pandemic. I like the product I wanted to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good value/reliable/accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice clean product. Other models we have had were much larger and inconvenient to carry around. So far this unit seems to give similar readings to another one we have that has been eating up batteries. This will be a good reliable replacement. The price was great and this can be recommended to keep track of oxygen daily
customer_reviews.author: JimmyC

customer_reviews.title: Great little device...
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this for elder uncle who have lung problems so I bought this so he could check my own blood oxygen level without the need of seeing my doctor or going to an emergency room. I like the added feature that it takes your pulse as well. My uncle really like this little device’s.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it's price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oximeter for my father who as recently placed on oxygen at home. It really is easy to use and read. When his nurse comes to visit him, she keeps telling me how my oximeter is better than hers. It is a great value and gives me great peace of mind to know that my dad is breathing fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing compact product
customer_reviews.text: I have never used an oximeter outside of a hospital and now I cannot imagine not having one. If you have an autoimmune issue or some kind of health issue then this oximeter is a must! It seems to run accurate, it is lightweight, it has an easy to read screen and is an amazing value.
customer_reviews.author: Yarabear

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: Would like to test it against a doctor’s office reading, but it seems good. I did notice that I can get different reading depending on the finger, but I can see where this might happen on those with poor circulation. Hence why I would like to test out against a doc’s office.
customer_reviews.author: Roxi B.

customer_reviews.title: An okay value
customer_reviews.text: Attaching the lanyard most difficult due to extremely small hole. Meter reacts quickly but reads on the low side until then slowly rises. This may be a function of sensitivity to finger movement. For the money it is a good value but if need precision and precise readings go for one that is medically approved at a premium price.
customer_reviews.author: Larry d

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: During this whole covid era I’ve been scrambling to find one of these to give my parents. It is easy to read and once you know how to, it is very helpful and gives you peace of mind. Taught them how to use it in one minute and is a very minimal price to pay for a potentially life saving piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: joseph kluger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read display, accurate, good for travel
customer_reviews.text: Display is nice and bright. Might have issues outdoors, but I can't say for certain. Works well in low light and dark environments in any case! Build quality is acceptable. You probably wouldn't want to throw it around. The readings seem to be very accurate and it works beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: slunky

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine up to now which the Oximeter just stopped working. Bought it in June and it now October, 4-5 months. So i say buy another brand that what I'm going to do So far it been a week since I cintacted the seller and no reponse.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rudolf

customer_reviews.title: Checking Blood Ox of Restrictive Lung disease in times of Covid
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this monitor on a Lightning Deal so that we could be checking my Blood Oxygen level. I have Restrictive Lung Disease which makes us a bit nervous in this time of Covid-19. Seems to give the same readings as my last doctors appointment. Of course, this device will not replacement regular doctors appointment or occasional arterial blood ox tests. But it does provide a quick, easy way to monitor my condition. The seller, Metene, has great communications and a two-year warranty extension is you register the device. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Watts

customer_reviews.title: Quick Oximeter Readings
customer_reviews.text: The fingertip oximeter is easy to use and provides almost immediate readouts. It came with an instruction booklet. The booklet lacked information that would be helpful. There was no chart displaying normal readings. Also, there was no information on how to attach the lanyard. Some may say the lanyard attachment is obvious but older people like to have the info included and not have to search for it. Fortunately the needed information can be found online.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: My mother is 87 years old. She was devastated when her doctors told her she would have to use an oxygen tank and check her oxygen levels. She immediately thought her life was over and she'd be ties to the house. She feared she didn't have to ability to do "all that technical stuff"! But of all the things that she'd had to adjust too using her oximeter has been comforting and allows her to feel in control. Thanks for the ease and simplicity . I'm self-employed and work with clients individually. Your product allows me to feel confident that mom is able to know if her oxygen levels are low so she can be at peace,
customer_reviews.author: cheri coleman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Oximeter!
customer_reviews.text: The oximeter is pretty straight forward and simple to use. It appears to be accurate, though I don’t have anything else to check it against. The numbers are easy to read and there’s really nothing bad I can say about it. It’s simple, it works, and it’s affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: Great price and easy to tell mine from other staff members. The issue is that it is difficult to read the display.
customer_reviews.author: Lenka

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This Oximeter works very quickly and efficiently. It came very quickly. It has been great to have as a reassurance during these times. The speed it reads is quicker than most I have seen at the doctor's office, the numbers are a good size and very easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read
customer_reviews.text: You have to use it a couple of times to get an accurate reading. The numbers are white on white and very hard to read.
customer_reviews.author: Nuckman

customer_reviews.title: useful for its primary purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Useful device but it has problems for people with a low heartrate - it seems to double it. My heartrate is usually below 50 bpm but the device reads it between 80 and 100. Not a problem if the heartrate is not prime reason for purchase. Keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: KiwiSam

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great time and seems to work well. It would be helpful if you could include what normal ranges should be for pulseox for us non-medical types. We use ours in the mountains and aren't quite sure what a normal range is. Otherwise, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Martial Arts Momma

customer_reviews.title: Large digital read out is nice for old eyes
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to understand instructions. I got this for my mother who needs to monitor her hearts bpm and of levels. The readout is in large numbers and she can easily read and record. The unit itself is nice and sturdy and well made. Glad we got this brand over other options
customer_reviews.author: Ducks_mom

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Do not this product if your trying to have accurate fast results. I am a visiting nurse and the other brands have been better. This starts off in the 70s and takes over a minute and a half. And still compared with other ones off by like 3-4%
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Marvel!
customer_reviews.text: This little device is a marvel. I'm 72 years old and had a lobe removed from my lung a year ago. My breathng is still limited but I'm not on oxygen or anything like that. Reading my numbers so easily and at home reassures me.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Lindroos

customer_reviews.title: Love the light up display
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! I love the light up display it makes it easy to read in my patients room at night so I don't have to turn on all the lights. Gives readings very quickly which is also a plus because trying to get a reading with a slow one on a shakey person is hard.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Just plug and play that's all. Only had to insert the batteries that came with box and then put my finger in and it showed the numbers. It's a great buy, especially in these times. Helps to keep a track of oxygen level as well as Heart rate monitor,
customer_reviews.author: AmitShenoy

customer_reviews.title: Great for its price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product a few days ago and it has been great since. The readings are very accurate and haven’t been bad for me yet. On terms of use ability I was able to quickly learn how to control the device and the reading numbers and bright and clear
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fast and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I know my base oxygen level and this oximeter is very accurate. The numbers are large and bright and it reads my oxygen levels really quickly! It comes with batteries and a strap for clumsy people out there like me. As a plus, I also love how sleek and modern it looks!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value for a fine product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is a fabulous value for the $$ paid! There was nothing to dislike about this product, except for the positioning of the lanyard hitch. We tried every trick in the book to try and attach the lanyard and our older hands could not navigate that hitch to thread the black line through and tie it off. Does metene have any hints on how to accomplish this? In the meantime, even without the lanyard, we are extremely pleased with this product and would gladly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: G. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Nice so far
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased 2 of these at seperate times one for my father the other for my grandmother. Got them on a special deal as well. So far they seem nice and comfortable on the finger tip. Pretty handy to have to keep track of oxygen count. We are pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mother, who has recently had a health scare necessary for this type of device. It seems to do decently well, but it has given a couple of bad readings. Upon immediate retrying it when that happened, it gave a seemingly more accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased...
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and the product. Works great and got it for an excellent price. I am more at ease knowing I have this in my home during these uncertain times. Appears to be pretty accurate but be careful to remain still during reading of course so jibbers don’t fluctuate.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty accurate I tested this and my friend's fitness watch at the same time and they where only 1 or 2 beats off The only down sides are you can't read it in sunlight and it doesn't read your heart rate if your finger is sweaty
customer_reviews.author: Barnum

customer_reviews.title: Quit working in the second week
customer_reviews.text: Quit working in the second week its to bad the display is bright easy to read it just didn't last will not syay turned on for more than 2-3 seconds and yes the battries are fresh . don't buy this one
customer_reviews.author: bryon fortun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I received this oximeter about 2 weeks ago (today is July 5, 2020) and it's been working great without any issues. It's super easy to use, push a button, put your finger into the device and in about 5 to 10 seconds you get a reading. I highly recommend this product. A bonus is the product came with batteries and a lanyard to hang the device around your neck if you choose to. I purchased this oximeter for $30 plus tax. With Amazon Prime received this product in about 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for Oxygen Levels and Pulse
customer_reviews.text: Pulse Oximeter is also used in by my doctor to measure pulse and oxygen levels in body. I compared the heart rate number with my pulse monitor and the numbers are same. This oximeter was affordable and a good buy. High recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to use. Bought for my stepson cuz he has asthma. I like how easy it is to read and also tells you your heartbeat. Only thing is I wish it came with a case but other than that this is a very good product and would reccomend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: B peterson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable pulse oximeter. Beautiful white casing with white numbers, looks elegant.
customer_reviews.text: I work at the covid unit and we monitor patients O2 sats frequently with or without activity so we know if they are ready to be weaned off their supplemental pxygen. I find this pulse oximeter reliable and accurate. Plus factor is the Beautiful white casing with white numbers, looks elegant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonuser1002

product_meta.title: Pulse Oximeter Fingertip, Blood Oxygen Saturation Monitor with Pulse Rate and Accurate Fast Spo2 Reading Oxygen Meter, Portable Oximeter with Lanyard and Batteries (White)
feature_bullets: 【Accurate And Reliable Detection】:Using the most advanced MCU chip and sensor, blood oxygen signal is collected by photoelectric sensing principle. Only need several seconds to get measurement results, very accurate and reliable.
【For Sports and Aviation Use Only 】: Suitable for sports enthusiasts and aviation use only , accommodates wide range of finger sizes - children to adult.

【User Friendly Design】: High quality transparent acrylic panel. The oxygen meter body is elaborately made of ABS material, very exquisite and compact. One button operation and shut down automatically without operation in 8 seconds. Large LED and backlight display make it very easy to read.
【Lightweight & Portable】: Metene fingertip pulse meter very light and easy to carry.This spo2 monitor is attached with detachable lanyard convenient to measure your oxygen saturation anywhere.

【You Will Get】：1*pulse oximeter, Lanyard, 2*AAA Batteries, 1*User Manual and 1* worry-free after-sale service. Please feel free to contact us if any quality issue within 12 months after the day of purchasing, we will reach back as soon as possible and try our best to make you satisfied.
